text: it's very hard hiring is the the most
important job of the CEO and it's the
hardest in many ways because if you
think about it um first of all the
screening process is broken right I mean
you get an email and a resume and you're
supposed to figure out who this person
is so clearly the screening process
means you're leaving some good people
behind and
and not so you know obviously that's the
whole purpose of using your network if
you can find someone who you're somehow
connected with that sort of is the
pre-screen process either through
someone so that helps with the screening
um you know I different people look for
different things i' I've you know part
of the reason I'm an entrepreneur is
that um I am not a political animal I
don't think I could ever succeed quite
frankly in a big Enterprise where in my
opinion um and this may be unfair to
people in big Enterprises where half the
battle of getting ahead is playing the
political game correctly it's not purely
about the best ideas and um in a startup
environment you get a chance to see your
ideas tried very quickly and it's not
about who you play golf with and so when
I'm hiring I try to look for people who
have succeeded environments where
politics probably wasn't part of their
success and there's ways to read that
you can read it in body language and and
in answers to certain questions um but I
really try to wean out the political
animals and focus on people who are um
really good not just really politically
Savvy and the other thing I do is I um
you know I think it's very important to
um ask them some questions that uh are
more on The Human Side not just you know
I the work you the work stuff is a given
do they have the skills you're going to
get that out of the way pretty quickly
but then you've got a sort of is this
someone I want to work with is this
someone I can trust is this someone
who's a team player and one of the
things I did with my first company
actually with with wine Chopper was um I
the condition of being hired was that
everyone was going to make the same base
salary and it was going to be
low and you know this is when you know
with Kleiner Perkins and Amazon backing
us they're a lot of people who were
coming to us with dollar signs in their
eyes and I said I want to wean out the
people that are really passionate about
this opportunity so I'm going to only
offer for these are and these were
people from Big seasoned people I'm
going to only offer $130,000 in salary
I'll take that salary and everyone will
get the same salary and for the first
year everyone's going to get the same
salary then after that it'll be more
Merit based and and that was really
effective at B building a cohesive team
because one
people who were in it just for the money
that was a turnoff for them and they
were out the door they never even
applied and then um everyone felt like
there's this whole sort of survey or
salary Envy thing that can happen in a
management team like how come that
person's getting paid more than if
everyone knows that everybody's paid the
same then it sort of breaks down that
one potential for um uh tension in the
office and it worked great we built at
wine Chopper it was probably the best
management team I've ever built I mean
it really was an excellent team and um
so it it's a tough process though and um
you do have to move quickly when you
make a mistake
